title: A HACK A DAY: How to make a Coke bottle air tank at home
text:
Deccan Chronicle | October 17, 2015, 11.53 am IST Share Tweet Electronic circuits attract a lot of dust and you need a powerful air blower to clean them out. The conventional blower and vacuum cleaner could do the job well, but smaller electronic gadgets such as cameras, smartphones, computers, etc need a less powerful and portable air blower. Opting for a pressurized air can is the best solution, but they are not refillable and are pretty expensive. Today’s hack will show you how you can make a simple air tank using a plastic soda bottle. The hack is cheap and simple and you can build one for your home. You can use it to clean the duct from almost anything around your house or vehicle.

Make your own laser beam burglar alarm for your house:
Having a security alarm system is a must for every house. Each security system is build for different purposes. While some are basic alarms, others are equipped with lasers and sound/motion detectors. Nevertheless using a CCTV setup is the best option for proof of theft and helping the cops zero in on the thief. Each security system comes at a huge price and they all depend on the type of detection system they incorporate. In video today, we will show you how you can build a very simple and cheap laser beam burglar alarm system. The laser beam can be setup with tiny mirrors around your house/room/area and when the beam is interrupted or broken, the alarm will sound off immediately. The parts used for the project are cheap and you can build one in under Rs 1,000.

How to fix a punctured tubeless tire on your own:
Having tubeless tires for your car or bike is a best option. Tubeless tires have no internal tube that requires to be inflated. They are just a tire attached to the rim, or wheel, and air is filled inside, keeping it inflated. The main and only benefit of a tubeless tire is that when you encounter a puncture, the tire does not deflate immediately and allows you go carry on driving or riding till you get a service center to fix it. On the other hand, a tube-based tire would immediately deflate and you will need to fix the puncture immediately. Fixing a tubeless tire is far easier than a one with a tube. In most cases, you don’t need to remove the wheel to repair the tire and the puncture can be fixed within a few minutes. All you need is a puncture repair kit which costs you just Rs 250 to Rs 500. You can store it in your car boot or under your bike’s seat and use it instantly when you require it. Fixing a tubeless tire is very easy and simple. The video here demonstrates how you can fix a tubeless tire puncture in under 10 minutes and save on time and fixing costs.

DIY special effects – cobwebs from styrofoam cups: Creating a scene with an old, unused look for your photos or videos can be done with special effects. To get an old, unused look in the scene, you should have dusty old furniture and appropriate looking walls apart from the rest. But without cobwebs, the scene is incomplete. In the video here, we show you how you can make your own cobweb effect using old styrofoam cups and some orange peel liquid. The effect is realistic and best of all, they are not permanent, can be cleaned out easily and reused again. DIY steadycam stabilizer for your DSLR camera:
If you keep taking videos using your DLSR camera (or even your handycam), you will definitely know how your videos are ruined when you shoot videos while walking or running. Your camera does not remain stable and video shake is visible in your final cuts. The onboard image or video stabiliser can do very little and your final videos are not professional-looking anyways. Opting for a steadycam rig can be expensive, but the results are definitely stunning. Why not build your own steadycam rig for stabilising your videos? The rig can be built in under Rs 1,000 (or even cheaper). Check out the video which explains the entire tutorial.

A stove or something to heat or cook your food is a necessity and a portable stove can come in handy. However, most portable stoves are either unnecessarily bulky or not as efficient as you need it to be. Why not make an efficient one for yourself? Protect your car from theft with a simple DIY kill switch:
Even if your vehicle is protected by a car alarm kit, professional thieves can easily hotwire it and make a run. Thieves are well acquainted with almost all types of car alarm systems and know how to disable or get around it. The only best way protect your car from being stolen is probably take off your car battery or the steering wheel and cart it home or to office each day. Not a practical option right? So why not make a secret hidden kill switch for your car so that you can still have it protected from thieves? The video here shows you how you can make and install a kill switch for your vehicle and secretly hide it inside your car. This way, only you know where the switch is and only you can turn on your car.
